name: CNS Involvement
title: CNS Involvement
notes:
**Note 1:** This SSDI is effective for diagnosis years 2023+. 
* For cases diagnosed 2018-2022, leave this SSDI blank

**Note 2:** Registrar is required to assign CNS Involvement based on the criteria provided in this data item
* If a physician documents the CNS Involvement, document this in the text field, but don’t use that to code this data item

**Note 3:** Criteria for CNS Involvement
* Clinical signs of CNS involvement
   * Radiologic evidence of intracranial, intradural mass
   * Cranial nerve palsy (e.g. facial weakness, ptosis), brain/eye involvement or hypothalamic syndrome
    * **Note:** Extra-ocular orbital masses, severe headaches and eye swelling (in the absence of signs of cranial nerve involvement) are **not** sufficient to constitute clinical evidence of CNS involvement
* The presence of blasts in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)
   * Cytospin is required to determine the presence or absence of blasts in the CSF. If Cytospin is not documented, assume there are no blasts in the CSF
   * If there is no mention of blasts, code blasts as absent
   * If blasts are referred to as “occasional” or “seen” or similar wording, code blasts are present
* Red and white blood cell counts from the cerebrospinal fluid  (RBC CSF and WBC CSF) 
  * Lumbar punctures are the most common way to collect this information 
  * If RBC <1/ul,  record as RBC = 0
  * If WBC <1/uL, record as WBC = 0
footnotes: (1) Aitken JF, Youlden D, O’Neill L, Gupta S, Frazier AL, eds. Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines – Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.
rows:
CNS1
* No clinical signs of CNS involvement AND
* No blasts in CSF

CNS2
- No clinical signs of CNS involvement AND blasts in CSF AND
  - WBC < 5/ul CSF
 
OR
- No clinical signs of CNS involvement OR blasts in CSF AND
  - WBC >= 5/ul CSF and 
  - RBC >= 10/ul CSF AND
  - WBC/RBC in CSF <= 2x WBC/RBC in blood

CNS3
- Clinical signs of CNS involvement 

OR
- Blasts in CSF and WBC >= 5/ul CSF AND EITHER
  - RBC < 10/ul CSF OR 
  - RBC >= 10/ul CSF and WBC/RBC in CSF > 2x WBC/RBC in blood

Not applicable: Information not collected for this case
(If this information is required by your standard setter, use of code 8 may result in an edit error.)

Not documented in medical record
CNS Involvement not assessed
N/A - Diagnosis year is prior to 2023
